p: The first COVID-19 patient, 35-year-old in Washington, admitted to a hospital on 15 January 2020, in the united states because of dry cough, two-day history of nausea and vomiting (Holshue et al., 2020). He reported that he had no shortness of breath or chest pain. The important signs, fever, cough, rhinorrhea, fatigue, nausea, vomit, diarrhea and abdominal discomport, were in normal condition. He had high fever 39.4 Â° C with cough at the eleventh day of hospitalized, on the evening of same day, clinical began treatment with intravenous remdesivir, next day, his clinical condition had improved. As January 30, he was still hospitalized but his symptoms had resolved exception of cough, which has decreased in severity.
